The chapter on the emissaries, the fourth chapter, has already extensively discussed karma.
That karma is accompanied by afflictions and experiences various births, not apart from afflictions.
The afflictions will now be explained.
All existences have roots, karma is their companion, and they give rise to a hundred sufferings.
Namely, they have seven latent afflictions, which the Sage says should be contemplated.

Namely, the existence of desire, the existence of form, and the existence of formlessness. These existences have seven latent afflictions as their seeds, because of afflictions there is karma, and because of karma one experiences birth.
Those afflictions, karma, and birth give rise to a hundred sufferings, not apart from karma.

When afflictions transform, they perform ten things, namely, the roots become firm, the parts continue to arise, in the field they give rise to, they rely on the seeds of results, karma has grasping, they are deluded about their own equipment, towards conditions they lead consciousness to flow, they do not allow the meaning of good karma to be transgressed, and they bind tightly, not allowing the expedient means of transcending the realms.
The wise should know this meaning.
Thus, these seven latent afflictions are divided into ninety-eight. Now, I will explain.
Distinguishing by realms, activities, and types, they are said to be ninety-eight,
Ten are eliminated by the path of cultivation, the rest are eliminated by the path of seeing.
These seven latent afflictions are distinguished by realms, activities, and types, becoming ninety-eight latent afflictions.

Among these seven latent afflictions, the latent affliction of sensual desire is divided into five types among the ninety-eight latent afflictions, and the latent affliction of aversion is also like this.
The latent affliction of attachment to existence is distinguished by realms and types, becoming ten.
The latent affliction of pride is distinguished by realms and types, becoming fifteen, and the latent affliction of ignorance is also like this.

The latent affliction of views is distinguished by activities, becoming five, distinguished by activities and types, becoming twelve, and distinguished by realms, activities, and types, becoming thirty-six.
The latent affliction of doubt is distinguished by realms and types, becoming twelve.
These are the seven latent afflictions distinguished as ninety-eight.
Question:
How many of these ninety-eight afflictions are eliminated by seeing, and how many are eliminated by cultivation?
Answer:
Ten kinds are eliminated by the path of cultivation, the rest are eliminated by the path of seeing.
Love, pride, and ignorance are divided into nine realms, anger is ten, and the remaining eighty-eight afflictions are eliminated by the path of seeing.
Because they are eliminated by temporarily seeing the truths, it is called the path of seeing.
If they are eliminated by repeatedly cultivating the path, it is called the path of cultivation.
If they are eliminated by the path of seeing, they are said to be eliminated by seeing.
If they are eliminated by the path of cultivation, they are said to be eliminated by cultivation.

In this way, the nine kinds of non-enlightened minds and enlightened minds are eliminated by the path of seeing, like the method of breaking a stone, and the method of cutting an lotus root. Before seeing the flame, after seeing the flame, when they are eliminated, one cultivates the path of four practices, which is eliminated by the path of seeing;
when they are eliminated, one cultivates the path of sixteen practices, which is eliminated by the path of cultivation.
The same is true for facing non-existent objects and facing existent objects.
The distinctions in the antidotes to the latent afflictions have already been explained, namely the distinctions in their types. Now the distinctions in their realms will be discussed.
There are twenty-eight latent afflictions, which are obstacles to seeing suffering.
When one sees suffering, they are completely eliminated without remainder.
Among the eighty-eight latent afflictions eliminated by seeing, twenty-eight are obstacles to seeing suffering, therefore they are eliminated by seeing suffering.
The meaning of elimination will be discussed later in this chapter.
Nineteen are eliminated by seeing the origin, and the same should be known for cessation.
Three more are eliminated by seeing the path, and ten are said to be eliminated by the path of cultivation.
Nineteen latent afflictions are eliminated by seeing the origin, because they are obstacles to seeing the origin, therefore they are eliminated by seeing the origin.
The same should be known for cessation means that nineteen latent afflictions eliminated by seeing cessation are also like this.
Three more are eliminated by seeing the path means that twenty-two latent afflictions are eliminated by seeing the path.
Ten are said to be eliminated by the path of cultivation means that ten latent afflictions are eliminated by the path of cultivation, as explained above.
The distinctions in the types of latent afflictions have already been explained. Now the distinctions in their realms will be discussed.
The first type of afflictions in the desire realm should be known as ten,
The second type has seven, the remaining eight are eliminated by the path of seeing.

The first type of afflictions in the desire realm should be known as ten means as previously explained, the first type of afflictions eliminated by seeing suffering are the ten fetters bound to the desire realm.
The second type has seven means the seven fetters eliminated by seeing the origin and cessation are bound to the desire realm.
The remaining eight are eliminated by the path of seeing means the eight fetters eliminated by the path of seeing are bound to the desire realm.
In the desire realm, four are eliminated by the path of cultivation,
It should be known that the same can be obtained in the upper two realms.

In the desire realm, four are eliminated by the path of cultivation means if the afflictions eliminated by the path of cultivation are four, they are bound to the desire realm. In this way, it is said that there are thirty-six fetters in the desire realm.
The remaining sixty-two fetters are in the form and formless realms.
Question:
How many are bound to the form realm and how many are bound to the formless realm?
Answer:
One should know that they are the same.
The thirty-one fetters are bound to the form realm, and the thirty-one fetters are bound to the formless realm.
The distinctions of realms and types have already been explained. The characteristics of the fetters will now be discussed.
Namely, the view of existence, the acceptance of extreme views, and wrong views,
The two attachments should be known, these five are called views.

The ignorant and foolish ordinary person, regarding the five aggregates of clinging, whether in themselves or in common, gives rise to the notion of I and mine, and firmly grasps onto this view. This is called the view of existence.
Regarding conditioned phenomena, to firmly grasp onto the views of annihilation or permanence, this is called the acceptance of extreme views.

To firmly grasp onto the view that there is no giving, etc., this is called wrong view.ğŸ”½To firmly grasp onto the view that defiled dharmas are supreme, and to cling to views, etc., because of rejecting equality, this is called the view of attachment to views.
To firmly grasp onto the view that defiled conditioned phenomena are pure, etc., and to cling to precepts, etc., because of rejecting equality, this is called the view of attachment to precepts.

Because these five afflictions are decisively cut off, they are called views. This one wrong view is wrongly decisively cut off, and because of the difference in practice, it is called the five views and two attachments. In the Sanskrit language, it can also be said to be ma, and it can also be said to be. These both have the meaning of stealing and the meaning of selection. Although it actually goes against reality, the intention is to seek the principle, so it is said to be selection.
What is accepted is not the way, so it is said to be stealing.
Greed, doubt, anger, pride, and delusion are said not to be views,
Because they arise from the distinction of objects, various names are established.
Greed, doubt, anger, pride, and delusion are said not to be views. Attachment to objects is called greed.
Regarding the truth, it is called doubt.
Anger towards sentient beings and non-sentient beings is called anger.
Arising with the intention of self-importance towards others who are inferior in terms of clan, surname, appearance, strength, wealth, power, skills, etc., is called pride.
Ignorance regarding the truth is called delusion.
Because these five afflictions are not of the nature of wisdom, they are not views.
These are the ten defilements.
As for the establishment of various names based on the transformation of distinctions in objects, these ten defilements establish various names based on the transformation of distinctions in objects.
If these defilements obstruct the view of suffering, they are said to be eliminated by seeing suffering.
Similarly, they obstruct the view of the origin, cessation, and path, and are said to be eliminated by seeing the path.
All are said to be eliminated by seeing the lower suffering, and two practices are free from three views.
The path eliminates two views, and anger does not occur in the upper realms.

As for all are said to be eliminated by seeing the lower suffering, lower suffering refers to the suffering of the desire realm. All ten defilements are contrary to the view of suffering and are therefore eliminated by seeing suffering.

As for two practices are free from three views, except for the views of self, extremes, and precepts, the remaining seven defilements are contrary to the view of the origin and cessation and are therefore eliminated by seeing the origin and cessation.
As for the path eliminates two views, except for the views of self and extremes, the remaining eight defilements are contrary to the view of the path and are therefore eliminated by seeing the path.
Question:
Why are the views of self and extremes eliminated by seeing suffering, not by the others?
Answer:

Because they revolve in the realm of suffering and revolve in the realm of fruits, seeing them is eliminated. The distant following faculties are not eliminated. Because these views are not following faculties, they are eliminated at the beginning when seeing the truth.
Question:
Why are the views of precepts and observances eliminated by seeing suffering and seeing the path, not by seeing accumulation and cessation?
Answer:
Because they arise in those realms.
Non-Buddhists are in opposition to those two truths, not to accumulation and cessation.
Because they are defiled in those realms, they desire to wash and bathe in the truth of accumulation and the truth of cessation.
If they are internal teachings, they are eliminated by seeing suffering. If they are external teachings, they are eliminated by seeing the path.
Question:
Why is the hindrance of doubt not eliminated by the path of cultivation?
Answer:
Because doubt is due to not seeing the matter, and seeing the matter eliminates it.
Because it arises in that place, there is no doubt eliminated by seeing the path of cultivation.
In the upper realms, anger does not occur. In the form and formless realms, anger is excluded, and the rest is explained as in the desire realm.

In the form realm, there are nine [afflictions] abandoned by seeing suffering, six abandoned by seeing the origin of suffering, six abandoned by seeing cessation, seven abandoned by seeing the path, and three abandoned by cultivation.
The formless realm is also like this.
Question:
Why are there no hostilities in the upper two realms?
Answer:

Because there is no shamelessness, lack of conscience, stinginess, jealousy, sorrow, or suffering nature there, because it is a place of tranquility and nourishment for the body, because one attains the mind of loving-kindness, because there is no nature of the nine afflictions, because one is free from the characteristics of harmfulness, and because one is free from one-sided unwholesomeness.
Because of the two fruits, there is hostility.
The establishment of the realms of the latent afflictions has already been explained. Now the all-pervading [afflictions] shall be discussed.
Doubt, views, and ignorance that pervade the causes of suffering,
These latent afflictions are of all kinds, that is, they exist in one realm.

Doubt, views, the ignorance associated with them, and the independent [ignorance] abandoned by seeing suffering and the origin of suffering - these eleven latent afflictions should be known as all-pervading in each realm, because their objects are extensive.

The five kinds of proclivities in one's own stage are like this. Those in higher stages do not give rise to proclivities in lower stages, because they are not their objects, because one is free from desire for them, and because they are already known and eliminated.
Those in lower stages do not give rise to proclivities in higher stages, because the inferior cannot be subject to the superior, and because the fruit of support cannot be obtained.
It should be known that all defiled dharmas are eliminated by seeing the truths, and they should be explained in this way.
Why is this?
Because the noble ones do not give rise to the fetters of non-existence, hatred, and pride, it should be said that they are eliminated, because they are not their objects.
The fetter of non-existence is nourished by the view of annihilation and arises in accordance with the view of annihilation;
because that view of annihilation is eliminated.
The fetter of hatred is nourished by wrong views and arises in accordance with wrong views;
because those wrong views are eliminated.
The seeds of pride are nourished by the view of a real self and arise in accordance with the view of a real self;
because that view of a real self is eliminated.
The all-pervading proclivities in one's own stage have already been explained. The all-pervading proclivities in other stages will now be explained.
The realms of other stages are its objects, excluding the two views as before.
Each stage has nine pervasive contaminants, but the peak of existence is not so.
Previously it was said that eleven are all-pervasive, excluding the view of self and extreme views. The remaining nine are all-pervasive.

From the desire realm up to the sphere of nothingness are the all-pervasive of other stages.ğŸ”½In the desire realm, the wrong views eliminated by seeing suffering, either by themselves or together, deny the fruits of the form and formless realms. The view of grasping at views takes them to be supreme. The grasping at morality and asceticism takes them to be pure. Doubt and ignorance arise, not understanding.

The wrong views eliminated by seeing the accumulation in the desire realm, either by themselves or together, deny the causes of the aggregates of the form and formless realms. The view of grasping at views takes the causes to be supreme. Doubt and ignorance do not understand.

Thus, in the first dhyÄna, wrong views abandoned by seeing suffering and origination, whether by themselves or in combination, deny the suffering and origination of the seven stages. In this way, it is explained in detail up to the stage of nothingness, where wrong views abandoned by seeing suffering and origination, whether by themselves or in combination, deny the suffering and origination of one stage. In this way, it is explained in detail.
In the stage of neither perception nor non-perception, there is no universal of other stages, because there is no higher stage.
The realms are also explained in the same way. In the formless realm, there is no universal of other realms and all stages, because there is no higher realm.
Question:
What is the meaning of universal?
Answer:
The meaning of universally taking all contaminated things as objects is the meaning of universal. The meaning of supporting by the power of taking as objects is the meaning of universal.
Because it arises from all, all sentient beings, and all things, it is called universal. There are no ordinary beings who originally do not take the view of self, etc. in contaminated dharmas.
Question:
Why are the views of self and extremes said to be universal in one's own stage, but not in other stages?
Answer:
Because it sees the present realm.
This view sees the present realm, not the lower realm seeing the higher realm.

Although one born in the higher realm sees the lower realm, it has been said before that the defilements of the higher realm do not take the lower realm as their object, because craving, hatred, and pride arise from their own characteristics.
They do not take other kinds as their objects, let alone other realms.
Although one who is not yet free from desire delights in the higher realms, this is desire, not craving.
If one takes suffering as one's object due to wrong views, this contradicts seeing suffering.
One realm takes nine realms as its object. Taking the cause as one's object is also like this.

If one takes suffering as one's object due to wrong views, this contradicts seeing suffering. One realm takes nine realms as its object. Wrong views eliminated by seeing suffering in the desire realm take the suffering of nine realms as their object, from the desire realm up to the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, not all at once. That is to say, the desire realm does not take the form realm or formless realm as its object. If it were different, then the knowledge of elimination would be destroyed, as well as the destruction of the realms.

The first trance takes eight realms as its object. The second trance takes eight realms as its object. Up to the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, it takes the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception as its object.

The same is true for the causes and aggregates. As it is said that wrong views to be eliminated by seeing suffering are eliminated by seeing suffering, wrong views to be eliminated by seeing the causes are also like this.
Question:
Why are only these called universal, and not other dharmas?
Answer:
If all universal contaminants have the same effect on conditioned dharmas,
One should know that they are universal, not for acquisitions, etc.
If the feelings, etc. associated with all universal contaminants, and the co-arisen, etc.,
They are also universal.
Because they have the same effect, because they are combined, because they follow each other, and because they do not fail to occur before and after, these are called universal.
Because the same effect, etc. are not by nature, acquisitions are not universal.
All universal contaminants are five kinds due to three things: five kinds of causes and conditions, five kinds of contaminants.
Those associated dharmas are five kinds, five kinds of causes and conditions, and five kinds of non-contaminants, because they are not by nature contaminants.
The dharmas that are concomitant with them are of five kinds, the causes are of five kinds, and the non-pervaders are of five kinds.
Therefore it is said.
If all-pervading contaminants are all-pervading causes, there are four alternatives.
All-pervading contaminants that are not all-pervading causes are future all-pervading contaminants.
All-pervading causes that are not all-pervading contaminants are past and present all-pervading contaminants and the concomitant and coexistent dharmas.
All-pervading contaminants that are all-pervading causes are past and present all-pervading contaminants.
Those that are neither all-pervading contaminants nor all-pervading causes are excluded from the above.
Wrong views, doubts, and the independent ignorance,
Should be known as having the pure realms as their objects, eliminated by the path of cessation and the path.

The ignorance associated with wrong views and doubts, and the independent ignorance, which are eliminated by the path of cessation and the path, should be known as having the pure realms as their objects in each realm.
The wrong views, doubts, and ignorance that are eliminated by the path of seeing cessation are eliminated by the path of seeing cessation.
In the same way, those eliminated by the path of seeing the path revolve around the path.
Question:
Are the wrong views eliminated by the path of seeing cessation seen and denied, or are they not seen?
If they are seen, they should not be denied, because they are seen.
If they are not seen, they should not have the uncontaminated as their object.
Answer:
They are seen and denied, but only by wrong views.
Just as a person in a certain place denies the place, so is it here.
Question:

Are the wrong views eliminated by the path of seeing suffering in the desire realm that take the suffering of the nine stages as their object, up to those eliminated by the path of seeing cessation in the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception that take the cessation of the one stage as their object?
Answer:
Otherwise,ğŸ”½ğŸ”½
Question:
How is it?
Answer:
If the cessation is the object of seeing, it is the cessation of the activities of one's own stage,
This is the object, not the other, because cessation is not a cause.

If the object of cessation is seen, the cessation of activities in one's own realm is the object, not others. The wrong view that eliminates the view of cessation in the desire realm takes the cessation of activities in the desire realm as its object, not the first trance.
The first trance up to the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception is also like this.
Question:
Why not in other realms?
Answer:
Because cessation is not a cause.
Because cessation is unconditioned, it is not a reciprocal cause.
Because it is not a reciprocal cause, the cessation of activities in one's own realm is the object of wrong view, therefore not others.
That is to say, one who well knows is also like this, is not so.
Why is it so?
Because it contradicts arising.
The activities of good knowledge contradict arising, therefore their arising is different from defiled [activities], because the conditioned realms cut off cause and effect.

That is to say, the wrong views abandoned by the path of seeing that take the suffering of one's own realm as their object are not so, because they mutually impel each other, whether in terms of arising, support, establishment, or cause, because they are mutually caused.
Question:
How does the wrong view abandoned by the path of seeing transform?
Is it like that abandoned by the path of seeing suffering and origination?
Or is it like that abandoned by the path of seeing cessation?
Answer:
It transforms differently.
Question:
How?
Answer:
If the path is the object, that view then takes the path as its object,
Because they mutually impel each other, [the wrong views] of the six stages and the nine stages.
Because the paths mutually impel each other.
The wrong views abandoned by the path of seeing in the desire realm take as their object the categories of dharma knowledge of the six stages, and the eight stages of the form and formless realms.

The wrong views abandoned by the path of seeing take as their object the categories of subsequent knowledge of the nine stages. Only dharma knowledge and subsequent knowledge mutually impel each other.

If those dharmas are moistened by desire-realm craving and are grasped as the self or belonging to the self, then the antidotes to those should be the objects of the wrong views abandoned by the path of seeing in the desire realm. These afflictions do not take other realms as objects.
The same should be said of the unknown knowledge.
Question:
Are the knowledge of cessation and path not the antidotes to the dharmas of the form and formless realms?
Therefore, that knowledge should be the object of the wrong views abandoned by the path of seeing in the form and formless realms. If it is not the object, it should not be said.

If the dharmas moistened by the craving of the form and formless realms are grasped as the self or belonging to the self, then the antidotes to those should be the objects of the wrong views abandoned by the path of seeing in the form and formless realms.
Answer:
Because neither is complete, there is no fault.

The knowledge of dharmas is not completely the antidote to those realms. Although the knowledge of cessation and path is not the knowledge of suffering and accumulation, the knowledge of cessation and path is also not completely the antidote to the form and formless realms.
Only the knowledge of dharmas of the path of cultivation is the antidote, not the path of seeing, because that is not a part of the beginning.

Therefore, what you say is not correct. It is like the faculty of pleasure, which is categorized as mental activity in the realm of manas. Based on the six consciousnesses, eighteen mental activities are established. The faculty of pleasure in the desire realm is not categorized as mental activity, so it is not established as mental activity.
Question:
Why are craving, hatred, pride, attachment to views, and attachment to precepts not related to the uncontaminated?
Answer:
Craving should not be blamed for its objects, as it does not cause harm,
is tranquil, supreme, and pure, so it is not related to the uncontaminated.
The wise see the faults of craving. If it were related to the uncontaminated, one should not see its faults. If one does not see its faults, one should also not eliminate it.
If one desires nirvana, this is wholesome desire and not craving.
Because it does not cause harm, hatred arises. It does not cause harm.
Because it is not tranquil, pride arises. It is tranquil.
Those who are attached to views take the supreme practice to be the supreme uncontaminated dharma.
If they take the uncontaminated as their object, they should be right views, not afflictions, because they are not inverted.
The same is true for the grasping of precepts.
Question:
What are the activities of the various entanglements?
Answer:
All the universal entanglements in the desire realm entangle all kinds,
and the bonds by means of objects are in one's own stage, and the same is true for the higher stages.

As for all the universal entanglements in the desire realm entangle all kinds and the bonds by means of objects are in one's own stage, the universal entanglements in the desire realm entangle the five kinds in the desire realm by means of objects.
Question:
What about the form and formless realms?
Answer:
The same is true for the higher stages.
Thus, the universal entanglements in the form and formless realms entangle the five kinds in their own stages by means of objects.
It should be known that the remaining entanglements take their own kinds as objects,
and entangle by means of objects their own realm, all the categories of support.

It should be known that the remaining defilements take their own seeds and their own objects as objects. The remaining defilements, both those that are not all-pervading and those that are all-pervading, take their own characteristics as objects.

The remaining defilements take their own seeds and the dharmas of all categories as objects. Whether all-pervading or not all-pervading, whether taking the contaminated as object or the uncontaminated as object, they each take the associated dharmas of their own category as objects.
If the defilements take the uncontaminated as object, they are defilements of other stages.
The associated defilements are due to the liberation of the object.
If the defilements take the uncontaminated as object or take the dharmas of other stages as object, they are the associated defilements of their own category, not the object-sphere defilements.
Why is this?
Because of the liberation of the object.

These defilements are liberated from their objects, because uncontaminated dharmas are liberated from all defilements, and the dharmas of higher stages are liberated from the defilements of lower stages.
Question:
How many defilements are there for each defilement?
Answer:
The seeds of those defilements abandoned by seeing suffering that are associated with the view of self are abandoned by seeing suffering.
Those that are abandoned by seeing the origin are all-pervading. The rest abandoned by seeing suffering are also like this.
The seeds of those defilements abandoned by seeing suffering that are associated with the view of self are abandoned by seeing suffering, because they are of the same kind.
And they are also associated with all-pervading defilements abandoned by seeing the origin, because they have a broad scope.
Question:
How about the remaining defilements abandoned by seeing suffering?
Answer:
The rest abandoned by seeing suffering are also like this.ğŸ”½As explained with the view of self, one should know that the remaining defilements abandoned by seeing suffering are also like this.
Those abandoned by seeing the origin are also like this. Those with contaminated objects in the realms of cessation and path are all-pervading.
They exhaust the seeds of their own kind. Those abandoned by the path of cultivation are also like this.
Those abandoned by seeing the origin are also like this. As explained with those abandoned by seeing suffering, those abandoned by seeing the origin are also like this.

The same applies to the defilements that are abandoned through the path of cultivation that have the cessation and path as their objects, and that have their own species as their objects. The same applies to the defilements that are abandoned through the path of insight into cessation and the path, and that are abandoned through the path of cultivation.

The difference is that the defilements that are abandoned through the path of insight into cessation and the path have their own species and the defilements that have impure objects as their objects, and the defilements that are abandoned through the path of cultivation have their own species and the universal defilements as their objects, and also have the pure objects as their objects.
Question:

We have already known that the defilements are the defilements of the defilements, and that the defiled are the defiled by the defilements. Who is the defilement by the condition as the object, but not by the association?
Up to who is neither the defilement by the condition as the object, nor by the association?
Answer:
The defilements that are abandoned through the path of insight into suffering are the defilements by the condition as the object and by the association,
and the ignorance associated with the views is the defilement by the condition as the object. The rest are also like this.
That is to say, the satkÄya-dá¹›á¹£á¹­i and the ignorance associated with the satkÄya-dá¹›á¹£á¹­i are the defilements of two kinds:
the condition as the object and the association.

The other defilements that are abandoned through the path of insight into suffering and all the universal defilements that are abandoned through the path of insight into the origination are the defilements by the condition as the object, but not by the association, because they are not of the same class.
The remaining proclivities are neither proclivities that are associated nor proclivities that are objects.
The view of self is not a proclivity.
The proclivity of the view of self and the associated ignorance are proclivities that are associated and proclivities that are objects.

The remaining proclivities eliminated by the path of seeing suffering and all the pervasive proclivities eliminated by the path of seeing the origin are proclivities that are objects but not proclivities that are associated.
The remaining proclivities are neither proclivities that are associated nor proclivities that are objects.
The extreme view, wrong view, attachment to views, attachment to precepts and vows, and doubt eliminated by the path of seeing suffering, as well as craving, anger, and conceit, are also like this.

The ignorance eliminated by the path of seeing suffering is neither a proclivity that is associated nor a proclivity that is an object with regard to the ignorance eliminated by the path of seeing suffering and all the pervasive proclivities eliminated by the path of seeing the origin.
The remaining proclivities eliminated by the path of seeing suffering are both proclivities that are objects and proclivities that are associated.
The remaining proclivities are neither proclivities that are associated nor proclivities that are objects.ğŸ”½The proclivities eliminated by the path of seeing the origin are also like this.
The proclivities eliminated by the path of seeing cessation and the path, as well as the proclivities eliminated by the path of cultivation, are also like this.
As for distinctions, if a latent tendency can be obtained through association, then it is both an associated latent tendency and an object-condition latent tendency.
If it is the view of cessation as an object, the ignorance that arises together with it,
and all the pervasive latent tendencies, they are incompatible with the object-condition latent tendencies of contaminated objects.

As for if it is the view of cessation as an object, the ignorance that arises together with it, the ignorance associated with the wrong view abandoned by the path of seeing cessation is an associated latent tendency, and the latent tendencies associated with that ignorance and wrong view are both associated latent tendencies.
Question:
How about the remaining latent tendencies?
Answer:

As for all the pervasive latent tendencies are incompatible with the object-condition latent tendencies of contaminated objects, if they are pervasive and abandoned by the path of seeing cessation, the object-condition latent tendencies of contaminated objects are object-condition latent tendencies, but not associated latent tendencies.
For this reason, it should be known that the remaining object-condition latent tendencies of uncontaminated objects are also like this.
As for the distinctions of the unique ignorance, it is not an associated latent tendency.
That latent tendency enters into the subtle, follows along, and also pursues,
It should be known that the fetters arise from three things, and so on.
As for the fetters, subtle entry, following entry, and also following, the fetters are the actions, subtle entry is the nature, following entry is the association, and following is the attainment.
Furthermore, the fetters are like a baby, subtle entry is the subtle activity, following entry is like oil in sesame, and following is like a shadow following movement in the air or water.
Question:
How do those fetters arise?
Answer:
It should be known that the fetters arise from three things, and so on.
There are three things that give rise to the fetter of greed: the power of cause, the power of objects, and the power of means.
The non-abandonment and non-understanding of the fetter of greed is the power of cause, the objects of the fetter of greed are the power of objects, and incorrect thought is the power of means.
This explains the complete causes and conditions of afflictions. It is not necessarily necessary to have all three things. If one must have all three things to arise, one should not regress.
It should be known that all the other defilements are also like this.
Question:
Are the defilements unwholesome or indeterminate?
Answer:
The view of self, the view of extremes, and the ignorance associated with them
are indeterminate in the desire realm, and all in the form and formless realms.

The view of self, the view of extremes, and the ignorance associated with them are indeterminate in the desire realm. The view of self and the view of extremes, as well as the associated ignorance, in the desire realm are indeterminate.
Why is this?
Because they do not contradict giving, morality, and cultivation.

If one who conceives of a self practices giving, it is for the sake of obtaining happiness for oneself in future lives. One also observes morality in order to be reborn in the heavens, and cultivates the path in order to attain liberation for oneself.
The view of annihilation accords with liberation.
Moreover, this view arises out of delusion regarding one's own affairs and does not arise out of oppressing others.
Those who conceive of a self say, when the eye sees forms,
I see, not the eye sees.
It does not oppress others by the view of self, therefore it is not unwholesome.
The other defilements of the desire realm are unwholesome.

As for the statement that all in the form and formless realms are neutral, the propensities in the form and formless realms are all neutral, because they do not destroy correct reception and because they do not have the nature of painful feeling.
The unwholesome has the retribution of painful feeling, but the form and formless realms do not have that.
The desire realm does not have the retribution of the form and formless realms, because the realm of retribution is cut off.
Question:
In which realm do the propensities arise?
Answer:
Greed, hatred, and pride may arise from the past,
The other two are bound to the past and future.

As for the statement that greed, hatred, and pride may arise from the past, the past greed, hatred, and pride are propensities of their own characteristics, so they cannot arise from all contaminated dharmas.
Greed cannot arise from objects that are not seen, heard, or thought of, but it arises through skillful means and becomes intense.
Sometimes there are people who give rise to craving for the eyes, not for other parts of the body.
Hatred and conceit are also like this.
As for the future, it is said that all means that future craving, hatred, and conceit bind the three times, because all contaminated dharmas are conditioned by the three times.
As for the other two times being exhausted bonds, view, doubt, and ignorance are the others. Because they arise with common characteristics.
If past and future bind the contaminated dharmas of the three times, the present passions are indefinite, so they are not mentioned.
If there are any, if the passions with specific characteristics appear in the present, they bind the present and future.
If they arise in the past, they have already ceased and are not severed.
Question:
Is it not the case that when the past passions are severed, those of the future are also severed?
Why is it said that those that arose in the past have already ceased and are not severed?
Answer:
It is not said because they are of the same kind. Sometimes the superior kind arises first.
If they are past and severed, then they are future and severed. The future soft afflictions that bind to that object are therefore without fault.
If the afflictions with common characteristics manifest, they bind all contaminated dharmas in the three times. This is a general statement.

If the afflictions of the five sense consciousnesses bind the past to the past, the present to the present, and the future that is about to arise to the future, then they bind the dharmas of the three times to the future that is not about to arise.
If they are of the mental ground, they completely bind the dharmas of the three times to the three times.
Question:
How do they bind?
Answer:
If the afflictions that bind the eye consciousness body bind the form that is the object of binding, they bind the associated dharmas through association.
Those associated dharmas are the mind entrance and the dharma entrance.
In the same way, up to the afflictions that bind the body consciousness body bind the tangibles that are the objects of binding, they bind the associated dharmas through association.
If the afflictions that bind the mental ground bind the twelve entrances that are the objects of binding, they bind the associated dharmas through association.
The associated dharmas are the mind faculty and the dharma faculty.
The VÄtsÄ«putrÄ«ya school says:
The person is real, the aggregates are real, and the events are real.
The Abhidharma masters say:
The person is unreal, the aggregates are real, and the events are real.
The storytellers say:
The aggregates are real, the person is unreal, and the events are unreal.

Because the objects are not fixed, sometimes desire arises, sometimes anger arises, sometimes pride arises, sometimes jealousy arises, sometimes disgust arises, sometimes compassion arises, sometimes equanimity arises.
The establishment of the defilements in the world has been explained. The sequence will now be explained.
The defilements arise in sequence, in one's own stage and in one's own stage,
And also from the upper stage to the lower stage. It should be known that they arise in sequence.

As for the defilements arise in sequence, in one's own stage and in one's own stage, all the defilements in one's own stage arise in sequence, one after another, in all the defilements in one's own stage.
It should be known that when one is born in a lower realm, it is in order. The afflictions of a higher realm give rise to the afflictions of a lower realm in order.

When one dies with a defiled mind, one gives rise to the intermediate existence and birth existence of a lower realm. The non-percipient and non-non-percipient realm gives rise to eight realms in order, up to the Brahma realm, which gives rise to the desire realm in order.
Question:
The World-Honored One has spoken of fetters, floods, clingings, bonds, and contaminations for these afflictions.
What are they?
Answer:ğŸ”½There are fetters, floods, clingings,
leaks, and bonds.
For this reason, fetters, floods, clingings, bonds are spoken of.
Because they are fettered by suffering, they are called fetters.
Therefore, there are four kinds:
the fetter of desire, the fetter of existence, the fetter of views, and the fetter of ignorance.
Question:
Why are the five views called the fetter of views,
and why is one ignorance established as one fetter?
Answer:
Because they are equally burdensome.
Question:
Why are the bonds of the form and formless realms, excluding the views and ignorance, established as one yoke?
Answer:
Because they are of the same right concentration stage and because they are hidden and neutral.
Because they cause sentient beings to drift, they are called floods.
They are also of four kinds, as explained in the yokes.
Because they grasp existence, they are called graspings, because they cling excessively.
They are also of four kinds:
the grasping of desire, the grasping of views, the grasping of precepts and observances, and the grasping of self-affirmation.
Question:
Why is ignorance called a yoke and a flood but not a grasping?
Answer:
Because it does not function swiftly.
The meaning of grasping is the meaning of clinging.
Ignorance does not function swiftly because it is dull, so it is not called a grasping.
Question:
Why are the four views called the grasping of views, and one grasping called the grasping of precepts and observances?
Answer:
Because they equally bear the burden.
That is, they can burn up karma and go against the path, and can be obtained internally and externally.
Non-Buddhists consider fasting and other hardships to be the path, while Buddhists consider the rag robes and so on to be the path.
Question:
Why are the bonds of the form and formless realms called self-grasping, but not those of the desire realm?
Answer:
Because they arise from internal bases.
The bonds of the form and formless realms arise internally, because they take oneself as their object.
The bonds of the desire realm arise externally, therefore they are called desire-grasping.
Because they are the outlet for all, and because the mind flows continuously, they are called outflows.
They are of three kinds:
desire-outflows, existence-outflows, and ignorance-outflows.
Question:
Why are the views called floods and bonds, but not outflows?
Answer:
The meaning of abiding is the meaning of outflow.
These views are swift and do not accord with abiding, therefore the other non-swift afflictions are said to be mixed.
The meaning of floating is the meaning of flood.
Views accord with floating, therefore they are established as floods.
The meaning of binding is the meaning of bonds.
Question:
What are the natures of the fetters, floods, clingings, bonds, and hindrances?
Answer:
There are twenty-nine, also said to be twenty-eight,
thirty-six, and fifteen. The natures of the fetters, floods, etc. of desire, etc.
The nature of the fetter of desire is twenty-nine:
five cravings, five hostilities, five arrogances, four doubts, and ten entanglements.
The entanglements will be explained later in this chapter.
The nature of the fetter of existence is twenty-eight:
ten cravings, ten arrogances, and eight doubts.
The nature of the fetter of views is thirty-six:
The five views, distinguished by realm and mode of activity, make thirty-six.
The fetter of ignorance, distinguished by realm and mode, is fifteen.
The floods are also like this.ğŸ”½Namely, the first thirty-four,
next, the seeds are said to be thirty.ğŸ”½The third is said to be six,
the fourth is thirty-eight.
The nature of the clinging of desire is thirty-four:
five cravings, five hostilities, five arrogances, five ignorances, four doubts, and ten entanglements.
The nature of the view of grasping at false views is thirty, excluding the grasping at precepts and vows.
The nature of the grasping at precepts and vows is six, distinguished by the realms and types as six.
It is said that the nature of grasping at the self is thirty-eight:
Ten attachments, ten prides, ten ignorances, and eight doubts.
The desire realm and form realm have two entanglements:
Drowsiness and agitation entanglements.
Because they are not distinguished by realms and types, they are not mentioned here.
It should be known that the nature of the desire realm outflow is forty-one,
The nature of the existence outflow is fifty-two, and the nature of the ignorance outflow is fifteen.
The nature of the desire realm outflow is forty-one:
Five cravings, five hostilities, five prides, four doubts, twelve views, and ten entanglements.
The nature of the existence outflow is fifty-two:
Ten attachments, ten prides, eight doubts, and twenty-four views.
The nature of the ignorance outflow is fifteen.
These are the one hundred and eight afflictions.
Because of the meaning of grasping, it is said to be grasping. Because of the meaning of being a leak, it is said to be a leak.
Question:
How do the various types of afflictions arise?
Answer:
Because of ignorance, there is doubt. Because of doubt, there is wrong view.
Because of this wrong view, various views of self arise.
First, because of ignorance, one does not wish for suffering up to the path. This is called ignorance.
Because of ignorance, there is doubt:
Is suffering not suffering?
Up to is the path not the path?
This ignorance turns and gives rise to doubt. Because of doubt, one seeks certainty.
If one obtains the correct method and gives rise to correct certainty, then there is suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path.
If one obtains the incorrect method and gives rise to incorrect certainty, then there is no suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path. This doubt turns and gives rise to wrong view.
If this is not suffering, then it is my self. This wrong view turns and gives rise to the view of self.
From this, extreme views arise, and the grasping of precepts and observances as supreme, and the grasping of views as supreme,
Having already determined this, next, the view of grasping at views as supreme arises.

If one sees the transformation and destruction of one's own view, one sees annihilation. If one sees a similar continuity, one sees permanence. This is the transformation of the view of self into extreme views.
If one sees one extreme as pure, this is the transformation of extreme views into the grasping of precepts and observances as supreme.
If one considers it to be the foremost purity, this is the transformation of the grasping of precepts and observances as supreme into the view of grasping at views as supreme.
One gives rise to desire for one's own views, and aversion towards the views of others,
One becomes proud when one's own views are praised. From the underlying tendencies, the entanglements arise.

One becomes attached to one's own views, averse to the views of others, and proud when one's own views are praised. This is the arising of desire, aversion, and pride from views. The entanglements of the higher afflictions arise from the underlying tendencies.
Question:
What are they?
Answer:
Shamelessness, lack of conscience, drowsiness, remorse, stinginess, jealousy, agitation,
Sleep, anger, and concealment - these are the entanglements of the higher afflictions.

The ten entanglements are shamelessness, lack of conscience, drowsiness, remorse, stinginess, jealousy, agitation, sleep, anger, and deceit. Their characteristics and functions have already been explained in the chapter on mental activities.

It is said that these are the basis of the defilements and the one who relies on them. The Sanskrit term is nisyanda, which means flowing out. It is said that the entanglements are the flowing out of the defilements, like the flowing out of ghee or honey from a bottle.
Question:
Which entanglements rely on which defilements?
Answer:
Shamelessness, drowsiness, and sleep rely on ignorance.
Agitation, stinginess, and lack of conscience arise from craving.
Shamelessness, drowsiness, and sleep rely on ignorance means that shamelessness, drowsiness, and sleep should be known to rely on ignorance.
Question:
If those entanglements rely on ignorance, are they associated with ignorance?
Answer:
If they rely on ignorance, they are associated with ignorance.
Or they may be associated with ignorance but not rely on ignorance, which are the other seven entanglements.
Distraction, stinginess, and lack of shame arise from craving. Distraction, stinginess, and the fetter of lack of shame are based on craving.
Question:
If the fetters are based on craving, are they associated with it?
Answer:
Four alternatives are made.
Those based on but not associated with it are the fetter of stinginess.
Those associated with but not based on it are lack of conscience, drowsiness, and sleep.
Those that are both based on and associated with it are distraction and lack of shame.
Those that are neither based on nor associated with it are except for what was said above.
The fetter of concealment is based on two defilements. Remorse is caused by doubt.
Anger and jealousy are based on hatred. This is explained by the wise.
The fetter of concealment is based on two defilements. Some say the fetter of concealment is based on craving, because one conceals through the power of craving.
Some say it is based on ignorance, because one conceals through the power of unknowing.
Remorse is caused by doubt. The fetter of remorse is based on doubt.
As for anger, jealousy, and hatred are based on clear wisdom, the fetters of anger and jealousy are based on hatred.
Question:
Among these afflictions and defilements, there are six. What are they based on?
Answer: The meaning of the ten fetters and six defilements is that tight binding is the meaning of fetters, and light bondage is the meaning of defilements.
Namely, the defilements of afflictions, harm, resentment, and hatred are based on anger.
Deceit and arrogance are based on greed. This meaning should be understood.
As for the defilements of afflictions, harm, resentment, and hatred are based on anger, harm and resentment are based on hatred.
Deceit and arrogance are based on greed. This meaning should be understood means that the defilements of deceit and arrogance are based on greed.
Namely, the five wrong views give rise to flattery based on them.
It is said that they are based on the fruit of the view of grasping at false views. This harm should be understood.
As for the five wrong views give rise to flattery based on them, the five views give rise to flattery based on them because they are quick and agile.
It should be known that the fruit of dependence on the view of grasping is vexation. Vexation is the dependence of grasping.
Question:
With which fetters are the various defilements associated?
Answer:
It is said that sleep and agitation are associated with all defilements,
and shamelessness is associated with all unwholesome [states], and lack of conscience is also so.
It is said that sleep and agitation are associated with all defilements. These two fetters are associated with all defilements.
Because all defiled minds are not tranquil, one should know agitation.
Because when defilements are present, the mind is incapable, one should know sleep.
Although agitation is not associated with agitation and sleep is not associated with sleep, because of their own nature and because they are few, they are not mentioned.
It should be known that the defilements are the same as the defilements, because those fetters are associated with all defilements.
The five kinds are the six consciousnesses, the unwholesome and indeterminate of the three realms.

Shamelessness and non-embarrassment are also like this. These two entanglements are associated with all unwholesome mental activities. When all unwholesome minds are present, they destroy respect and fear of wrongdoing. Therefore, these entanglements are said to be of five kinds and belong to the six consciousnesses. Because they are unwholesome, they are bound to the desire realm.
Regret is in the mind and is painful, and is eliminated by the path of cultivation.
Sleepiness is only in the desire realm and the mind, and the others are established by themselves.
Regret is in the mind and is painful. Because regret is swift,
it arises with sorrow and is associated with worry, and because it is included in painful feelings, it is in the desire realm.
Question:
What eliminates this?
Answer:
It is eliminated by the path of cultivation.
Because it arises from good and evil conduct, it is eliminated by the path of cultivation.
Sleepiness is only in the desire realm and the mind.
When sleeping, all afflictions accompany it, and therefore it is associated with all afflictions in the desire realm.

The remaining ones are established by themselves. The remaining entanglements and above afflictions are established by themselves, namely anger, concealment, stinginess, and jealousy are not associated with other proclivities.
Except for ignorance, it should be known that regret is also established by itself, because the other afflictions are not of the nature of regret.
Question:
Why are stinginess and jealousy established among the nine fetters, but not the others?
Answer:
It is said that stinginess and jealousy stand alone, apart from the two.
Therefore, these two entanglements are established among the nine fetters.

The two entanglements of stinginess and jealousy arise by their own power, so they stand alone. Because they are exclusively unwholesome, they are apart from the two. For this reason, they are established among the nine fetters.
As for drowsiness and agitation, they are not established by themselves because they accompany all afflictions. Because they are both unwholesome and indeterminate, they are not apart from the two.
Sleep is also not established by itself because it is associated with other proclivities. Because it is wholesome, unwholesome, and indeterminate, it is not apart from the two.
Shamelessness and lack of conscience are apart from the two, but they are not established by themselves.
Although remorse exists independently, it is not apart from the two, because it is either wholesome or unwholesome.
Although anger and concealment exist independently, they are also apart from the two.

Some people want to make them the nature of the defilements. They record that there are eight entanglements. If remorse and drowsiness are wholesome, they should be known as not entanglements, because entanglements are exclusively defiled.
Question:
Why is craving established as one fetter and two defilements, or three or six?
Answer:

Because it obtains the characteristic of one bondage, one fetter is established. Because of the definite and indefinite stages, two defilements are spoken of. Because of the distinction of realms, three are spoken of. Because of the distinction of bases, six are spoken of.
Question:
Why are the three views established as the fetter of views, and the two views as the fetter of grasping others?
Answer:
Because of the same name, and because of the same matter.
The view of self, extreme view, and wrong view are the female name, and the nature of the eighteen kinds of fetters, therefore one fetter is established.
The fetter of grasping others is the male name, and they are also the nature of the eighteen kinds of fetters, therefore one fetter is established.
Therefore, it is said in this way.
If there is bondage by the fetter of craving associated with the view of existence, it is not the bondage of the view of existence, nor is it the bondage of the view of non-existence.

If the knowledge of origination has arisen but the knowledge of cessation has not yet arisen, there is bondage by the fetter of craving associated with the views of existence and attachment to observances and rituals that are to be eliminated by the path of cessation and the path of vision.
Because the fetter of craving has contaminated objects as its objects, it is not the fetter of the view of existence.

Because all the fetters of the view of existence have been eliminated, although the fetter of the view of existence of its own kind has not been eliminated, it does not take that as its object, because it has pure objects as its objects and is not a concomitant category.
It is not the case that the view of existence does not bind, because the five views are the fetter of the view of existence and the three views are the fetter of the view of existence.
The intrinsic nature of the afflictions has already been explained. Now the root afflictions and their concomitants will be explained.
The afflictions in the three realms are all associated with the faculty of equanimity,
The afflictions in each stage are associated with the faculties of that stage up to the realm of form.
The afflictions in the three realms are all associated with the faculty of equanimity means that all the afflictions in the three realms are associated with the faculty of equanimity.
Why is it so?
Because it accords with all afflictions, because it arises together with joy, sorrow, and the associated afflictions, and because all afflictions cease in the middle.
If it were different, there would be no separation from afflictions. Therefore, the faculty of equanimity obtains the five kinds of consciousness bodies and the three realms.

Ignorance is associated with all faculties.
Hatred and doubt are only associated with suffering in the desire realm. Doubt is associated with suffering because it is indecisive and not joyful.
The faculties of the first and second dhyanas are associated with the faculty of joy. The faculty of joy in the desire realm is coarse.
Beings should not give rise to it, yet they do. It is like a poor person who always laughs and plays, giving rise to things that should not be given rise to.
Doubt in the desire realm is subtle, so it is not associated with the faculty of joy. Hatred arises from the activity of sorrow, so it is associated with the faculty of suffering.
